metadata.synopsis: Shadowheart meets with her old friend once again. Talking about the past and discussing what the future is going to look like.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. Go with shadowheart to the grotto2. Talk to Nightshade.

11.speaker: Nocturne
11.text: Shadowheart... I wasn't sure if I'd ever lay eyes on you again. It's me, Nocturne. Do you remember?

34.speaker: Narrator
34.text: *You recall the memory Shadowheart recovered by eating the noblestalk - this must be the person she remembered.*

2.speaker: Shadowheart
2.text: I remember you, but you're different... very different. I used to call you something else, didn't I?

64.speaker: Nocturne
64.text: You did - but that's not who I am now. I remember the other initiates used to tease you about your name - the one you chose to honour Lady Shar.
64.context: NodeContext: Lighthearted. Flyby reference to their pronouns on 'I'm them'.

17.speaker: Nocturne
17.text: They were attacking who you were. I never found it funny, but wasn't quite sure why. Eventually I realised it was because I wasn't happy with who I was.
17.context: NodeContext: Lighthearted. Flyby reference to their pronouns on 'I'm them'.

8.speaker: Nocturne
8.text: I couldn't keep going like that. But seeing how you fought on, I realised that I didn't have to. From then on, I was Nocturne. It wasn't easy... but everything started to make sense. I could breathe.
8.context: NodeContext: Lighthearted. Flyby reference to their pronouns on 'I'm them'.

42.speaker: Shadowheart
42.text: It's a beautiful name. Suits you well.
42.context: NodeContext: Lighthearted. Flyby reference to their pronouns on 'I'm them'.

61.speaker: Nocturne
61.text: Thank you. Picked it myself. But enough of that - I can't believe you're back.
61.context: NodeContext: Lighthearted. Flyby reference to their pronouns on 'I'm them'.

38.speaker: Shadowheart
38.text: I've been trying to return here as long as I can remember... which admittedly doesn't amount to much.
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart gives a questioning glance to the player after Nightshade speaks ('what DOES come next?')

70.speaker: Nocturne
70.text: They... they whispered it was a suicide mission, this search for the artefact you were sent on.
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart gives a questioning glance to the player after Nightshade speaks ('what DOES come next?')

63.speaker: Nocturne
63.text: Some even thought it was the Mother Superior's plan alone, and not Lady Shar's intent...
63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart gives a questioning glance to the player after Nightshade speaks ('what DOES come next?')

6.speaker: Nocturne
6.text: It seems the whispers were right on that last part, my lady. At some point she confused her ambitions for the Nightsinger's will.
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart gives a questioning glance to the player after Nightshade speaks ('what DOES come next?')

68.speaker: Nocturne
68.text: But no matter - you rule us now. What comes next?
68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart gives a questioning glance to the player after Nightshade speaks ('what DOES come next?')

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Viconia is defeated. It's up to you what happens to her followers.

20.speaker: Shadowheart
20.text: Her followers... and my friends, in at least some cases. I was so focused on getting here, on finishing this, I forgot about the life I had here.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: You command this place now, Shadowheart. What happens is your choice.

26.speaker: Shadowheart
26.text: I wish... to know more. There must be all sort of things you can tell me. Little things from my past, lost to Lady Shar's embrace.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: I didn't see her amongst your supporters fighting Viconia. You shouldn't trust her.

67.speaker: Shadowheart
67.text: Perhaps you're right... but I trusted her once. That has to count for something.

48.speaker: Shadowheart
48.text: There must be all sorts you can tell me. Things I can't even remember.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: She's one of them. You can't trust her.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: I expect you'll have catching-up to do.

5.speaker: Shadowheart
5.text: Indeed. There must be all sorts of things you could tell me.

31.speaker: Nocturne
31.text: There are... but you need to finish what you came here for. Everyone knows you've been blessed, that you're coming for the Mother Superior. I won't stand in your way.

4.speaker: Nocturne
4.text: Still, we need to be careful... The Mother Superior holds a tight grip on this place. But perhaps I can help you in the meanwhile.

54.speaker: Nocturne
54.text: Come see me when you have time - I work as quartermaster now. I can sell you some things... and we can catch up.

55.speaker: Nocturne
55.text: If you wish it of me... of course, my lady. I work as the quartermaster. Come see me whenever you wish.

52.speaker: Shadowheart
52.text: Indeed. There must be all sorts of things you could tell me.

65.speaker: Nocturne
65.text: There are... but you need to finish what you came here for. If half of the rumours about what was done to you are true... well, I won't stand in your way.

60.speaker: Nocturne
60.text: Still, we need to be careful... The Mother Superior holds a tight grip on this place. But perhaps I can help you in the meanwhile.

27.speaker: Nocturne
27.text: Come see me when you have time - I work as quartermaster now. I can sell you some things... and we can catch up.

58.speaker: Nocturne
58.text: There are... but with the Mother Superior gone, I don't know if I can stay here to reminisce. Perhaps there's another enclave out there for me.

30.speaker: Nocturne
30.text: You don't, perhaps. Not everyone is as brave.

62.speaker: Nocturne
62.text: I'll leave come tomorrow. Come see me before then - I was working as quartermaster. I can sell you some things to aid you... and we can catch up.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: You can reminisce after you've dealt with Viconia, Shadowheart.

47.speaker: Nocturne
47.text: You're right. I need to finish this.

23.speaker: Nocturne
23.text: I'll need to be careful... The Mother Superior holds a tight grip on this place. But perhaps I can help you in the meanwhile.

19.speaker: Nocturne
19.text: It seems the whispers were right, on that last part. At some point she confused her ambitions for the Nightsinger's will.

41.speaker: Nocturne
41.text: Be careful... Whatever she has planned, I don't think she'll shed any tears if you are a casualty along the way.

44.speaker: Nocturne
44.text: But now it seems you've turned on both the Mother Superior and Lady Shar...

46.speaker: Shadowheart
46.context: NodeContext: A touch suspicious - greeted warmly by someone she doesn't remember.

16.speaker: Nocturne
16.text: We... we trained together. We used to be close.

51.speaker: Nocturne
51.text: I'm glad to see you're all right.

56.speaker: Nocturne
56.text: Ah... a pity. Perhaps we can talk some more later. That is, if you wish, my lady.

3.speaker: Nocturne
3.text: Ah... a pity. Perhaps we can talk some more later, if you wish.

7.speaker: Nocturne
7.text: They said the hunt for the artefact was a suicide mission - I feared I wouldn't see you again. Some even thought it was the Mother Superior's plan alone, and not what Lady Shar wanted...

69.speaker: Nocturne
69.text: Ah... a pity. Perhaps we can talk some more later, if you wish.

32.speaker: Nocturne
32.text: Ah... a pity. Perhaps we can talk some more later. That is, if you're not about to turn on me... It seems you no longer walk in the Dark Lady's shadow.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Then you two are enemies - not friends.

18.speaker: Nocturne
18.text: Not if Shadowheart doesn't wish for it. She helped me be true to myself - I will not begrudge her for doing the same... even if it displeases Lady Shar.

50.speaker: Nocturne
50.text: Not if Shadowheart doesn't wish for it. She may not remember, but we shared a lot together once. Good times, hard times... I will not turn on her. Even if it angers Lady Shar.

35.speaker: Shadowheart
35.text: Shar condemned me. By her decree, you and I are enemies.

10.speaker: Nocturne
10.text: Only if you wish us to be. You helped me be true to myself - I will not begrudge you for discovering yourself... even if it displeases Lady Shar.

37.speaker: Shadowheart
37.text: That's... good enough for me. I'm not sure what I expected coming back to this place - certainly not a friend.

53.speaker: Nocturne
53.text: Only if you wish us to be. You may not remember, but we shared a lot together once. Good times, hard times... I will not turn on you. Even if it angers Lady Shar.
